pageContext.claim: “You take a look at the blackouts in California; it's really rather amazing what's going on there. They've tried to go, and that's just with a small portion going that route. That doesn't work, and it can't fire up our big plants. We're going to have this great industry that we've created. Can't fire up our big plants.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump suggests the rolling blackouts are the result of California’s shift away from fossil fuels. Cal Matters reports the shift left the state unable to fire up old plants, and the blackouts were caused by multiple factors including resource allocation. Lack of renewable energy was not one of the factors.
